extendedIngredients.name: cooked chicken breasts
extendedIngredients.originalString: 12 ounces chicken breasts, cooked and cubed

extendedIngredients.name: green beans
extendedIngredients.originalString: 6 cups green beans, steamed until crisp-tender

recipes.title: Comforting Chicken Casserole with Green Beans

winePairing.pairingText: Chardonnay, Pinot Noir, and Sauvignon Blanc are great choices for Chicken. White meat is typically paired with white wine as to not overpower the flavor of the meat, so chardonnay and sauvignon blanc are safe choices. Chicken prepared with a tomato sauce or certainly a red wine sauce can and should be served with a red like a pinot noir. One wine you could try is Chehalem INOX Chardonnay. It has 4.1 out of 5 stars and a bottle costs about 13 dollars.

productMatches.title: Chehalem INOX Chardonnay
productMatches.description: INOX® takes its name from the abbreviation of the French word for stainless steel, inoxydable. The wine was created differently from most Chardonnay you've had. We think we've succeeded in expressing the crisp, steely, and fruit-rich side that we love about some Old-World Chardonnays. What makes this possible is the use of exclusively Dijon clones, exceptionally well suited to Oregon's cool climate and exhibiting a richness that does not depend on oak. INOX screams of the hallmarks of a cool climate-brightness, pinpoint fruit, and explosive aromas and flavors. We intend INOX for a full range of use, from hot weather chilling to elegant dinner complements.Quintessential INOX, with lovely white aromas of gardenia and other flowers, peach, apricot, pear, pineapple, and green apple candy showing on the nose and palate; it shows a great balance with relatively low alcohol for the year and bright acid; the length is lovely and the weight rich, with a supple, silky texture; flavors linger, with cherry and peach accents. Very pleased.

recipes.instructions: (This recipe uses pre-steamed beans and leftover chicken breast meat.)Preheat a large skillet over medium heat. Add olive oil and onions. Cook for 5 minutes until very soft. Add water or vegetable broth by the tablespoonful to keep from burning.Add green beans, cooked chicken, parsley, red pepper and garlic. Cook another 5 minutes to warm through. In a bowl combine milk, sour cream, Dijon mustard and horseradish. Add milk mixture to the pan and turn the heat up to medium-high. Bring ingredients to a bowl, then reduce heat and simmer for 5 minutes until sauce thickens.Serve topped with Parmesan cheese curls.

steps.step: (This recipe uses pre-steamed beans and leftover chicken breast meat.)Preheat a large skillet over medium heat.
Add olive oil and onions. Cook for 5 minutes until very soft.
Add water or vegetable broth by the tablespoonful to keep from burning.
Add green beans, cooked chicken, parsley, red pepper and garlic. Cook another 5 minutes to warm through. In a bowl combine milk, sour cream, Dijon mustard and horseradish.
Add milk mixture to the pan and turn the heat up to medium-high. Bring ingredients to a bowl, then reduce heat and simmer for 5 minutes until sauce thickens.
Serve topped with Parmesan cheese curls.
